verses.roman:
brāhmaṇārtho hy apahṛto
hartāraṁ pātayaty adhaḥ
ajānantam api hy enaṁ
nṛgaṁ brāhmaṇa-gaur iva

synonyms: brāhmaṇa—of a brāhmaṇa; arthaḥ—the property; hi—indeed; apahṛtaḥ—taken away; hartāram—the taker; pātayati—causes to fall; adhaḥ—down; ajānantam—unaware; api—even; hi—indeed; enam—this person; nṛgam—King Nṛga; brāhmaṇa—of the brāhmaṇa; gauḥ—the cow; iva—as.
translation: When a brāhmaṇa's property is stolen, even unknowingly, it certainly causes the person who takes it to fall down, just as the brāhmaṇa's cow did to Nṛga.

purport.content: The Lord here demonstrates that His instructions are not theoretical but practical, as seen concretely in the case of Nṛga Mahārāja.
